description:
Schrankia costaestrigalis is a species of moth belonging to the family Erebidae. It is commonly known as the pinion-streaked snout or the small pinion-streaked snout.

This small moth typically has a wingspan of around 18-22 millimeters. Its forewings are greyish-brown in color, with distinct dark streaks along the costa (the leading edge of the wing). The hindwings are greyish-white. The species is known for its distinctive snout-like palpi, which are characteristic of the Pyralidae and Erebidae families.

Schrankia costaestrigalis is widely distributed across Europe, including the United Kingdom, and parts of Asia. The larvae of this species feed on various low-growing plants, such as dead-nettle (Lamium) and wild strawberry (Fragaria).

This moth is considered a common and widespread species within its natural range. It is typically found in a variety of habitats, including woodlands, grasslands, and urban areas.
